intro: Pleurothyrium pauciflorum, commonly known as the few-flowered pleurothyrium, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a small shrub characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, with four petals. Its fruits are small berries that contain several seeds. It is native to tropical regions of South America and is often found in humid, lowland forests.
